tweets.text:
@markrwilliamson @Cambswater @camcitco Would that be @Cambswater suggesting that 30 years plus of data collection, kick sampling, reporting writing, ecological investigations, endless studies by @EnvAgency, National Rivers Authority and others was all totally pointless and needs done again?

https://t.co/tkFovOC9Wp

Field teams are on the ground again today checking structures and clearing trash screens etc. We are also proactively managing flows on the Parrett by using Monksleaze Clyse and the Sowy system. @EnvAgencySW @GaryBCutts https://t.co/9wkmpRSEs2
Flood alerts and warnings in place in parts of the Midlands today. Stay #floodaware and up to date with the latest info here: https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/sd1Pb9llxL
There are 3 flood warnings in place due to heavy rainfall this weekend. Stay up-to-date for any new warnings at https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15 https://t.co/795mcBl25Y https://t.co/OUo68xCu0F

#floodalert #bradfordonavon - thanks to CEV Sarah with the last report of today at 21:00hrs. River level 26.85m AOD and rising. Barriers & EA onsite team all fine for the night shift with lots of capacity left in the river. @EnvAgencySW @BoATownCouncil @DWFRSBoA @WiltshireRoads https://t.co/WRh3ECJQAf

Due to the heavy rain and rising water levels in main rivers this weekend we are using Monksleaze Clyce and the SOWY flood relief channel to divert excess water out of the Parrett. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/CFtT9ef0EC

#floodalert #bradfordonavon - thanks to CEV Peter for the 09:00hrs report. River level 27.1m AOD but still plenty of room in the river. Church Street still flooded and barriers and EA site team all fine! @EnvAgencySW @DWFRSBoA @BoATownCouncil @Trow_Fire_Stn @WiltshireRoads https://t.co/nOl3b1EF8D

Our Field Teams have been working through the night to keep our communities safe from #flood risk. 

As this graph from Morris Brook shows, clearing debris from watercourses drops levels significantly. You can see when the teams attended & cleared the screen as water levels fall https://t.co/BvaJoFLdM0

tweets.text:
Confirmation untreated sewage still being discharged from Chesham Sewage Treatment Works, going on since 8.30pm Friday 2nd Oct, expect this will continue today Sunday 4th Oct and probably into Monday. If you see discoloured water report to @EnvAgency 
 Hotline 0800807060

Our staff @NatResWales are working tirelessly this weekend. We currently have 20 flood alerts in force for #Wales, primarily in the South West. So please take care, #StaySafe and follow @metoffice, @NatResWales and our England counterparts @EnvAgency for all the latest updates. https://t.co/2L7wZ96dMb

tweets.text:
#faggoting, where branches of any tree species, preferably #willow, are bundled together and then held at the base of the eroding bank by stakes. #riversevern #erosion #conservation 

@EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @NE_WestMids @severnrivers @FWAGSouthWest @theriverstrust @NFFNUK https://t.co/QWoixlNE92

10.10am, Sunday

Flooding is POSSIBLE in parts of #London, #Hertfordshire, #Buckinghamshire, #Oxfordshire, #Surrey, #WestSussex, #Hampshire and the #IsleofWight...

The latest at https://t.co/hxkRVJuQTt, including how to get flood alerts on you phone! Stay #floodaware https://t.co/JegtzXYd26

I am on duty as our Field Operations Duty Officer.  Field teams have been out checking some of our Flood Storage Areas as they operate. They are just heading home. I am checking CCTV on trash screens, until the teams are home safe and sound. #teamEA #24/7 ‚Å¶@EnvAgencyYNE‚Å© https://t.co/u0Fnk57KHB
@IndyHothi @Hillingdon @CllrMathers Thanks, Indy. Do call us if you spot anything. We have now arrived - you might see our staff. Peter

W COUNTRY: As of 0600GMT Sunday, 72hr rainfall accumulations for our region as per map below. This doesn't include additional rain gauges from @EnvAgency & private sites, with higher values reported in places. Note 109mm at Winchcombe #Gloucestershire; 101mm Liscombe, #Somerset https://t.co/4gMg9TDXyr

Enforcement patrols out yesterday engaging with River users  in the #Cleeve Reach a total of 138 vessels checked ,46 booked unregistered and 16 No name issued .#TeamEA @EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @wifo_ea @TobyWillisonEA

A #flood alert has been issued for the River Bollin catchment including #Knutsford #Wilmslow #Macclesfield & #Bollington. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring river levels & will issue further warnings if necessary. 
Ôøº
Check your risk ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/aL4XRtmV9i https://t.co/oehdSx2aLk

Weather looking a bit better in Yorkshire & North East today. Two flood warnings issued early this morning for Bishop Monkton and Roecliffe. Masham still in force (#Boroughbridge #Ripon #NorthYorks), plus flood alert at River Wansbeck, Morpeth. See more at https://t.co/xADRoYQTUa https://t.co/x4D4gDoA9k

urls.title: The Thames Barrier
urls.description: How the Thames Barrier works, and when it is scheduled to close.

tweets.text:
üöß Don't be alarmed if you see or hear about the #ThamesBarrier in SE London closing today...

It's a TEST. An annual check to protect London from flooding...

You can read more about one of the world's largest flood barriers: https://t.co/YFBsQvpjWB #floodaware üöß https://t.co/21C53q7lhN

tweets.text: @IndyHothi @Hillingdon @CllrMathers Hello, Indy, thanks for geting in touch. We have staff en route to clear any blockage. We‚Äôll investigate what happened. Please keep in touch, and report any new concerns to us: 0800 807060. Peter

Flood warning issued for Masham, North Yorkshire. Levels on Swinney Beck have risen due to heavy rain. Expected to peak early Sunday. Do not walk or drive through fast moving water. Keep up-to-date and sign up to flood warnings at https://t.co/xADRoYzivA #StormAlex https://t.co/d0ihH498xZ
The @EnvAgency has issued 1 flood warning and 3 flood alerts for Cumbria. Full info hereüëá https://t.co/O0IP47qfho

Just 6 months after admitting to 8,400 pollution incidents in court @SouthernWater still manage to top the 2019 polluter in chief scoreboard.

What's clear is the @EnvAgency has no control over this company and even clearer, it is now time for @Ofwat to revoke SW's licence. https://t.co/1KqXjd6XYE

@AndynBrown16 @EnvAgencyNW @CumbriaRain Yep, anyone got any questions about our river levels online service, river levels or want to know raw rainfall data, just tweet me and happy to answer. Keep safe peeps ü§ó

An amber #rain warning remains in effect this morning across parts of England and Wales

More info found here: https://t.co/QwDLMfRBfs 

Stay #WeatherAware ‚ö†Ô∏è https://t.co/kwvm9sco1N
Thank you Kitty, very worrying and the @thameswater Chesham Sewage Treatment Works is still discharging today. https://t.co/xFPJIaXXob

@Hillingdon @EnvAgencySE @CllrMathers significant flooding of River Colne and Frays river In West Drayton due to a blockage. c. 40 households and numerous businesses at risk in the Thorney Mill Road/Cricketfield Road area. What's your action?

@Feargal_Sharkey @SouthernWater @EnvAgency @Ofwat I used to junior for Southern Water‚Äôs QC. When I mentioned I swam at my riverbank on the Medway, he laughed and said words to the effect of: you shouldn‚Äôt do that, you don‚Äôt know how much shit they‚Äôre putting in there. Their poor record is apparently a humorous in-joke now.
@markrwilliamson @Cambswater @camcitco @EnvAgency And why I wonder are @camcitco @wildlifebcn and @WildTroutTrust going along with this charade?

Heavy üåßÔ∏è is forecast across the #NorthWest this weekend

If you are travelling & see a road covered in water don't drive through it ‚ùå. It is often deeper than it looks & just 30cm of flowing water is enough to float your car

Stay safe & check your risk üëâhttps://t.co/DelUfH7Qeq https://t.co/0DJ8tz2TaH

urls.title: Find out if you're at risk of flooding in England
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, check the 5-day forecast or use flood maps

tweets.text: 30cm of flowing water is enough to move your car. Never drive through flood water. What to do during a flood: https://t.co/yOnoPDvQSt https://t.co/YJEHqUeOdx
There are currently 3 flood warnings in the South West. If you are concerned about flooding,  check https://t.co/QdPKdFg7SD https://t.co/KnFqnsvDKX

More stormy and persistent rain is expected this weekend across parts of England.
